qas.question: How does the financial backing of universities around the world differ?
In nations that accept students from through the world what might the university offer to a student?
Outside of state funded schools, and funds coming from donors, how might a university collect funds?

answers.text: fees which students attending the university

qas.question: How does the financial backing of students around the world differ?

plausible_answers.text: attract students from all over the world, and may provide university accommodation for their students

qas.question: What do other states do for students?
Where do the vast majority of students have funding from their hometown?
Who are students in some countries predominatly funded by?
Where does the funding and organization of students vary?

context: The funding and organization of universities <a0_0><b3_0>varies widely<b3_0/><a0_0/> between <b7_0>different countries around the world<b7_0/>. In some countries universities are predominantly funded by <b6_0>the state<b6_0/>, while in others funding may come from donors or from <a2_0>fees which students attending the university<a2_0/> must pay. In <b5_0>some countries<b5_0/> the vast majority of students attend university in their local town, while in other countries universities <b4_0>attract students from all over the world, and may provide university <a1_0>accommodation<a1_0/> for their students<b4_0/>.
